text: Quand j’étais en C.-B., j’ai rencontré Jean. C’est pour des gens comme elle que je me suis lancé en politique : pour créer des possibilités, pour faire du Canada un pays où de grands projets peuvent naître et pour aider les Canadiens à améliorer leur quotidien.pic.twitter.com/FVi7kvg6WL

Last time I was in B.C. I met Jean. Stories like hers are why I’m running to be Prime Minister: to create opportunity, to make Canada a country where big projects can succeed, and to let Canadians get ahead.pic.twitter.com/P59qeuevrm

Charlie- What on earth made you think Greens proposed privitization of water - anywhere? If #SNCLavalin is found guilty, sentencing them to install safe drinking water as public infrastructure, without profit, was my suggestion. FN's would own/ control. #GPChttps://twitter.com/CharlieAngusNDP/status/1154810309854543872 …

Justin Trudeau has expressed his “admiration” for “China’s basic dictatorship”, but this is too much. The Trudeau government is trying to intimidate and silence former diplomats, journalists and citizens. This is not how a free country should operate.pic.twitter.com/8KCBCcCI2R

Justin Trudeau a exprimé son « admiration » pour la « dictature chinoise ». Il va trop loin ! Le gouvernement Trudeau tente d’intimider et de museler d’anciens diplomates, des journalistes et des citoyens. Ce n’est pas comme ça qu’un pays libre fonctionne.pic.twitter.com/5wvr5VvnSI

Our New Deal for People will create over half a million homes across Canada & ensure federal land sold for housing will be used for housing people can afford – instead of a cash cow for luxury condo developers.http://bit.ly/2Yog3ty

Too many people in Toronto are struggling to afford a home that's too expensive, overcrowded or even unsafe. Yet the Trudeau gov't is allowing prime federally-owned land to be sold off for luxury condos on the waterfront for the ultra-rich. Today the NDP demanded a stop to this.pic.twitter.com/u09iRHcGvC

Nous sommes déterminés à créer plus d’un demi-million de logements au & veiller que la vente de terrains fédéraux serve à construire des habitations dont les gens peuvent se payer, au lieu d’être une vache à lait pour les promoteurs de condos de luxe.http://bit.ly/2Y9rees

Trop de gens à Toronto peinent à se payer un logement trop cher, surpeuplé, voire insalubre. Or, le gouvernement Trudeau tolère la vente de terrains fédéraux pour bâtir des condos de luxe sur le bord de l'eau pour les ultra riches. Le NPD a exigé aujourd’hui qu’on y mette fin.pic.twitter.com/WhvlrqmPEz
The @Lima2019Games kick off today! Good luck, #TeamCanada - we can’t wait to see how many records you break, podiums you stand tall on, and personal bests you beat. #GoCanadaGo

7/ Verdict: This is pro-mass immigration CBC propaganda. Nothing I said is being refuted in this hit piece. Only 26% of all immigrants directly answer our economic needs. We must accept more of these, and fewer of the others who are a burden for Canadian taxpayers.

6/ What I said is that none of these 74% were chosen to directly fulfil our economic needs. Many will not work. But even those who find work do not have the right qualifications we need, and earn less than other Canadians for most of their lives, as Gatehouse confirms.

5/ But that’s not at all what I said. Excerpt from my speech: “three quarters of all immigrants who come to Canada are dependents, DO NOT HAVE THE RIGHT QUALIFICATIONS THAT WE NEED, may not master any of our official languages, OR are too young or too old to work.”

4/ Gatehouse then writes that “nothing prevents them from seeking work” and proceeds to give stats showing a large proportion of them do work, which according to him proves that my statement was “patently false.”

3/ This gives the impression I said that 74% of immigrants – those who are not directly chosen on the basis of their skills and work qualifications, but come as spouses, children, under family reunification, or as refugees – are ALL dependent children or seniors who won’t work.

2/ He writes: Per Bernier, that means "only 26 per cent of all the people who come to Canada every year actually fulfil our economic needs," and that the remainder are "dependents" who "may not master any of our official languages, or are too young or too old to work."

1/ Another unprofessional and intellectually dishonest CBC “journalist,” @JonGatehouse, claims to have refuted a key part of my speech on immigration by selectively quoting from it and making me say something I did not say.https://twitter.com/CBCTheNational/status/1154758268545200131 …
